meanings.definition: To live longer than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: The wise tortoise outlived the speedy hare in the race.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother outlived all her siblings.
meanings.sent3: The old tree outlived the new saplings around it.
meanings.sent4: Her legacy outlived her, spreading far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins outlived the civilizations that built them.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be relevant longer than expected.
meanings.sent1: Despite the changes, the classic novel outlived all modern trends.
meanings.sent2: The traditional values of the community outlived the passing fads.
meanings.sent3: The old-fashioned hat outlived its owner, becoming a fashion statement.
meanings.sent4: His reputation outlived the scandal, proving his innocence.
meanings.sent5: The timeless melody outlived generations, still touching hearts today.
